column4: If your install is at the middle/end of the disk, can you go back and remove/resize partitions at the beginning of the disk without the who partition table collapsing?
if you have a partitioning tool to do it, yes. ubuntu doesn't currently have a simple, graphical one though
log in, go to Computer (menu at the top) -> System COnfiguration -> Screen Resolution
typically the framebuffer can support the same resolutions as X, although it would depend on exactly which framebuffer driver it was using. It's almost certainly not using a framebuffer driver though
